newsitem.title: FRANCE: Sommer-Allibert up on earnings report.
newsitem.headline: Sommer-Allibert up on earnings report.

text.p: Sommer-Allibert shares rose sharply on Friday on a better than expected results report which prompted two brokerages to upgrade the shares.

Brokerage houses SBC Warburg and Du Bouzet both upgraded the stock to a "buy" from a "hold" or an "accumulate" after the release on Wednesday evening of Sommer-Allibert's 1996 results, which showed a 36 percent increase in net attributable last year to 241.8 million francs from 177.7 million in 1995.
The share closed at 190.3 francs per share on Friday, up 5.78 percent for the day.
Marc Gouget, an analyst at Du Bouzet, said he revised upward his estimate of 1997 profit to 280 million francs from 250 million, and of the 1998 profit to 320 million francs from 290 million.
